title: Magda Szubanski looks relaxed as she steps out of a spiritual wellness clinic in Melbourne
text:
She is known for leaving audiences in stitches with her hilarious gags and one-liners.

But last week, Magda Szubanski looked rested and relaxed as she left spiritual wellness clinic, The Swell Centre, in Melbourne.

The Kath and Kim star, 58, was seen leaving the facility in all-black ensemble.

Feeling zen! Magda Szubanski looked relaxed while leaving a spiritual wellness clinic in Melbourne last week

She matched the outfit with round dark sunglasses, a watch and toted her backpack.

For a little pop of colour, she wore a pair of bright training shoes that looked comfortable.

The writer and human rights campaigner was then seen getting into her car.

Keeping a low profile: She kept a low profile leaving The Swell Centre dressed in an all-black ensemble

Magda is set to appear at a Sydney Town Hall on Tuesday night, where Former Prime Minister Julia Guillard will be speaking.

The former politician, who is the Chair of mental health charity Beyond Blue, will be discuss discrimination, the social and emotional well-being for the Indigenous community, as well as the need for mental health system reform.

Earlier this year, Magda candidly spoke about her experience of coming out as gay on The Project in 2012.

Advocate: Magda is attending an event at Sydney Town Hall on Tuesday night, where former Prime Minister Julia Guillard is set to speak about discrimination, the well-being for the Indigenous community and mental health system reform

'Having gone through the whole journey of coming out - not just about sexuality but about who I really am in terms of revealing my beliefs, my morals, my intelligence, my real talents along with my flaws and weaknesses - I've felt like a butterfly shaking off a carapace,' Magda said in an official statement to publication.

'I cannot emphasise enough the sense of generous, openhearted empowerment that flows into you when you finally are standing on the solid ground of your authentic self.'

Magda came out in 2012 while campaigning for gay marriage in Australia, appearing on The Project to announce: 'I am gay, gay, gay, gay gay.'
description: She is known for leaving audiences in stitches with her hilarious gags and one-liners.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
